name: Headers
description: The Headers interface of the Fetch API allows you to perform various actions on HTTP request and response headers. These actions include retrieving, setting, adding to, and removing. A Headers object has an associated header list, which is initially empty and consists of zero or more name and value pairs.  You can add to this using methods like append() (see Examples.) In all methods of this interface, header names are matched by case-insensitive byte sequence.

parameters.name: init Optional
parameters.description: An object containing any HTTP headers that you want to pre-populate your Headers object with. This can be a simple object literal with ByteString values; or an existing Headers object. In the last case, the new Headers object inherits its data from the existing Headers object.

members.name: Headers.append()
members.description: Appends a new value onto an existing header inside a Headers object, or adds the header if it does not already exist.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header you want to add to the Headers object.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the HTTP header you want to add.

members.name: Headers.delete()
members.description: Deletes a header from a Headers object.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header you want to delete from the Headers object.

members.name: Headers.entries()
members.description: Returns an iterator allowing to go through all key/value pairs contained in this object.

members.name: Headers.get()
members.description: Returns a ByteString sequence of all the values of a header within a Headers object with a given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header whose values you want to retrieve from the Headers object. If the given name is not the name of an HTTP header, this method throws a TypeError.

members.name: Headers.has()
members.description: Returns a boolean stating whether a Headers object contains a certain header.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header you want to test for. If the given name is not the name of an HTTP header, this method throws a TypeError.

members.name: Headers.keys()
members.description: Returns an iterator allowing to go through all keys f the key/value pairs contained in this object.

members.name: Headers.set()
members.description: Sets a new value for an existing header inside a Headers object, or adds the header if it does not already exist.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header you want to set to a new value. If the given name is not the name of an HTTP header, this method throws a TypeError.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value you want to set.

members.name: Headers.values()
members.description: Returns an iterator allowing to go through all values of the key/value pairs contained in this object.

members.name: Headers.getAll()
members.description: Used to return an array of all the values of a header within a Headers object with a given name; this method has now been deleted from the spec, and Headers.get() now returns all values instead of just one.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the HTTP header whose values you want to retrieve from the Headers object. If the given name is not the name of an HTTP header, this method throws a TypeError.
